perturbation.original_text:
Accounting statements and, if applicable, royalty payments
         for products sold will be rendered by each party quarterly within sixty
         (60) days after the expiration of each calendar quarter.
perturbation.changed_text:
Accounting statements and, if applicable, royalty payments
         for products sold will be rendered by each party quarterly within ninety
         (90) days after the expiration of each calendar quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction in the payment terms. Originally, account statements were due within 60 days of the quarter's end. Now, they are due within 90 days. This introduces ambiguity as to which deadline is applicable.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party, at its sole expense, upon at least
         thirty (30) days written notice (and not more than once in respect of
         any accounting period) will have the right to inspect the other party's
         books regarding the obligations hereunder for a period of two (2) years
         from the date on which any statement is rendered.
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party, at its sole expense, upon at least
         fifteen (15) days written notice (and not more than twice in respect of
         any accounting period) will have the right to inspect the other party's
         books regarding the obligations hereunder for a period of one (1) year
         from the date on which any statement is rendered.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces several contradictions. The notice period for inspections changes from 30 days to 15 days, the number of inspections allowed per accounting period changes from one to two, and the period for which books can be inspected is reduced from two years to one year. This creates uncertainty regarding inspection rights.

perturbation.original_text:
Thereafter, it will be deemed to have consented to any such statements
         or accountings which will then be considered an account stated as
         between the parties, not subject to any objection for any reason
         whatsoever. Provided the objecting party has made timely written
         objection, as aforesaid, such party may file an action regarding same
         within two (2) years and six (6) months after the applicable statement
         is rendered, after which time any such action will be deemed barred.
perturbation.changed_text:
Thereafter, it will be deemed to have consented to any such statements
         or accountings which will then be considered an account stated as
         between the parties, not subject to any objection for any reason
         whatsoever. Provided the objecting party has made timely written
         objection, as aforesaid, such party may file an action regarding same
         within one (1) years after the applicable statement
         is rendered, after which time any such action will be deemed barred.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the time frame within which a party can file an action regarding accounting discrepancies. It reduces the time from two years and six months to one year, creating confusion about the deadline for legal action related to accounting statements.
